meanings.definition: As a verb: to gather or assemble (a group of people or things)
meanings.sent1: The teacher musters the students before the field trip.
meanings.sent2: She musters all her courage to speak in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The team musters for practice, but end up having a dance party instead.
meanings.sent4: He musters his thoughts before making an important decision.
meanings.sent5: The farmer musters his animals into the barn before the storm.

meanings.definition: As a noun: a formal gathering of troops for inspection or display
meanings.sent1: The general led the musters to review the soldiers' uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The annual military musters are always impressive.
meanings.sent3: The musters turned into a friendly competition of marching skills.
meanings.sent4: The historical reenactment included a grand display of musters.
meanings.sent5: The musters showcased the strength and unity of the army.
